problem_text:
(E. Rapaport Strasser). The Lovász conjecture states that a vertex-transitive connected graph is Hamiltonian. In the special case of Cayley graphs, one can ask the following. Consider a set A which generates a group G and is symmetric (x ∈ A implies x^{-1} ∈ A). Is there a list a1, a2, . . . , an of elements of A such that a1, a1a2, a1a2a3, . . . , a1a2 · · · an is a complete list of the elements of G?
B. Green
